columns.text: In this problem, we will solve fro the price per share of the company's stock using the price-sales ratio.

In the problem, it is stated that the sales or the revenue for the duration is $\$29,200,000$ with outstanding shares of $400,000$. We can then take the revenue per share by dividing the sales by the number of outstanding shares.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Revenue per share}&=\dfrac{\text{Total sales}}{\text{Number of outstanding shares}}\\[15 pt]
&=\dfrac{\$29,200,000}{400,000}\\[15 pt]
&=\$73.00
\end{aligned}$$

The revenue per share is at $\$73.00$

Now that we have the revenue per share which is given at $\$73.00$ and the price-sales ratio of $2.45$, we can now solve for the Price per share using the formula in Step 2.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Price-sales ratio}&=\dfrac{\text{Price per share}}{\text{Revenue per share}}\\[15 pt]
2.45&=\dfrac{\text{Price per share}}{\$73.00}\\[15 pt]
2.45\times \$73.00&=\text{Price per share}\\[15 pt]
\text{Price per share}&=\$178.85
\end{aligned}$$

Here, we can see that using the given price-sales ratio and the revenue per share, we can get the price per share which is $\$178.85$
